Osteoarthritis

Osteoarthritis is a condition in which the joints of the body become damaged, stop moving freely and become painful. It's the most common form of arthritis in the UK.
The risk of developing osteoarthritis increases from the late 40s.
How many people have osteoarthritis in the UK?

In the UK, 8.75 million people in the UK have sought treatment for osteoarthritis.* This means:Women are more likely than men to have sought treatment. affects your life and mobility at any age.
